main event: On July 9, 1960, a bright white disk-like object with a diameter of approximately 20-25 ft was observed hovering and moving at high speed in Mason, Ohio.
interesting points: The object flickered and appeared to be rising,It hovered for a brief period of 4-5 seconds before moving rapidly to the south,Astro charts indicated a star pattern near the reported position, but movement was inconsistent with astronomical observations,The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes,The source concluded it was probably astrological with insufficient data for firm evaluation.
witness description: The witness described seeing a bright light that seemed to move up and down without staying in one spot.
